Element.name: ErrorFlow
Element.Description: An Error Flow is the flow followed when an operation fails.

PropertyCategory.name: AJAX
PropertyCategory.Property: If checked, the target page is opened inside a user interface window behaving as a child of the navigation starting page.

If checked, the user interface window containing the navigation starting page is closed before opening the new window. This effectively causes the new window to replace the previous one under the same parent page.

If checked, the opened window is displayed with a title.
The displayed title depends on the 'Window Title' property.

Text used as title for the opened window.
Has no effect if 'Use Title' is unchecked.

Width of the opened window in pixels.
Default value: 200

Height of the opened window in pixels.
Default value: 300
If checked, the opened window can be resized by the user.
If checked, the opened window automatically resizes itself according to the content.

If checked, the opened window displays a button to close it on the client-side.
Note that no model flow is navigated when windows are closed this way.
If checked, the opened window displays a button to maximize it.
If checked, the opened window displays a button to minimize it.
If checked, the opened window can be moved by the user.
If checked, the opened window blocks interaction with all parent pages until it is closed.
The CSS class to apply to the opened window.

Effect to use for showing the opened window.
Possible values are:
  • None,
  • Appear,
  • BlindDown,
  • SlideDown,
  • Grow.

Effect to user for hiding the opened window.
Possible values are:
  • None,
  • Fade,
  • BlindUp,
  • SlideUp,
  • Shrink.
